thread.title: ANGELS: Dean Chance, Cy Young winner, dies at age 74
thread.title_full: ANGELS: Dean Chance, Cy Young winner, dies at age 74 - Press Enterprise

author: JEFF FLETCHER
title: ANGELS: Dean Chance, Cy Young winner, dies at age 74
text:
By JEFF FLETCHER / STAFF WRITER
Published: Oct. 11, 2015 Updated: 2:48 p.m. ANGELS: Dean Chance, Cy Young winner, dies at age 74 Print Photo Share Pin It More Galleries ADVERTISEMENT Angels pitcher Dean Chance winds up in this 1967 photo. BOB WHEELER Related article » Dean Chance, the 1964 Cy Young winner and a recently inducted member of the Angels Hall of Fame, has died. He was 74.
Chance was found unresponsive at his home on Sunday morning, a family member told the Wooster (Ohio) Daily Record .
Chance was a member of the original Angels team in 1961. A 6-foot-3 right-hander, Chance was a two-time All-Star and a two-time 20-game winner.
In 1964, Chance was 20-9 with a 1.65 ERA, winning the Cy Young Award at a time when there was only one winner, rather than one for each league. Chance and Bartolo Colon, who won in 2005, are the only Angels pitchers to take the award.
Chance spent six years with the Angels, compiling a 74-66 record and a 2.83 ERA.
This summer chance returned to Anaheim to be inducted into the teamâs Hall of Fame. He was inducted along with Tim Salmon and Mike Witt.
